verses.text: 獻贖愆祭的幾種事例「如果有人犯罪：他聽見發誓的聲音（「發誓的聲音」或譯：「傳召作證的聲音」，或「發咒語的聲音」）；他本是證人，卻不肯把看見或知道的說出來，他就要擔當自己的罪責。

words.note: A specific type of offering in Levitical law.
Refers to sin against God, not just secular crime.

verses.text: 或人摸了甚麼不潔淨的東西，無論是不潔淨野獸的屍體，或是不潔淨牲畜的屍體，或是不潔淨昆蟲的屍體，當時並不留意，他因為成了不潔淨，就有罪了；

words.note: Used to intensify a negative statement.

verses.text: 或有人摸了人的污穢，他沒有留意玷污了甚麼污穢；他一知道，就有罪了。

words.note: Often paired with '就' for 'as soon as... then...'

verses.text: 或有人嘴唇輕率發誓，無論是出於惡意或是出於好意，他沒有留意起了甚麼誓；他一知道，就有罪了。

words.note: In this context, '起誓' means 'to take an oath'.
Often paired with '就' for 'as soon as... then...'

verses.text: 如果他在任何一件事上犯了罪，就要承認自己所犯的罪；

words.note: Used as a locative suffix with '在'.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., '所犯的罪' = 'the sin committed'.

verses.text: 他要為所犯的罪，把贖愆祭帶到耶和華面前當作贖罪祭，就是羊群中的母羊，或綿羊羔或山羊；祭司就為他的罪行贖罪。

words.note: Indicates something that is V-ed

words.definition: to serve as, to be regarded as

words.note: Refers to a young sheep, often used symbolically.

words.definition: to atone for sin, to make expiation

verses.text: 「他的經濟能力若是不夠獻一隻羊，他就要為所犯的罪，帶兩隻斑鳩或兩隻雛鴿到耶和華面前作贖愆祭，一隻作贖罪祭，一隻作燔祭。

words.note: Indicates something that is V-ed

verses.text: 他要把牠們帶到祭司那裡，祭司就要先獻上作為贖罪祭的一隻，把鳥的頭從頸項上扭斷，只是不可撕斷。

words.definition: to serve as, to act as
to wring off, to twist until broken
to tear off, to rip apart

verses.text: 然後他要把贖罪祭牲的一些血，彈在祭壇旁邊，其餘的血要在祭壇腳那裡擠出來；這是贖罪祭。

words.definition: to squeeze out, to press out

verses.text: 第二隻作為燔祭的鳥，要按照燔祭的規則獻上，祭司為他的罪行贖罪，他就蒙赦免。

words.definition: to serve as, to act as
to atone for sin, to make expiation

verses.text: 「他的經濟能力若是不夠獻兩隻斑鳩或兩隻雛鴿，就要為所犯的罪，帶來一公斤的細麵作贖罪祭的供物；供物不可澆上油，也不可加上乳香，因為這是贖罪祭。

words.note: Lit. 'redeem sin sacrifice'.
General term for offering or tribute.

verses.text: 他要把供物帶到祭司那裡，祭司從其中取出一把，作為象徵，放在祭壇耶和華的火祭上面焚燒；這是贖罪祭。

words.note: Lit. 'sacrifice manager'.
Often refers to burning sacrifices or ritual burning.

verses.text: 祭司為他所犯的任何一樣罪贖罪，他就蒙赦免。其餘的祭物（「其餘的祭物」直譯是「它」）要歸給祭司，好像素祭一樣。」

words.note: To receive forgiveness or a pardon.
Lit. 'plain sacrifice', typically a non-meat offering.

verses.text: 贖愆祭的條例耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Lit. 'redeem transgression sacrifice'.

verses.text: 「如果有人在耶和華的聖物上不忠實，無意犯了罪，他就要依照你按著聖所衡量銀子標準所估的銀價，把他的贖愆祭牲，就是羊群中一隻沒有殘疾的公綿羊，牽到耶和華面前作贖愆祭。

words.note: Lit. 'holy thing'.
Lit. 'holy place'.
Can refer to silver as a commodity or currency.
Can refer to a physical defect or disability.

verses.text: 他要補償他在聖物上所虧欠的，另加五分之一，交給祭司；祭司要用贖愆祭的公綿羊為他贖罪，他就蒙赦免。

words.note: Refers to items dedicated to God.
Introduces a passive or noun clause.
In this context, often refers to a debt owed to God or for sacred things.
A minister of sacred duties, especially in ancient Israel.
A specific offering for unintentional sins or trespasses.
Often used for sacrificial animals in the Bible.

words.definition: atone for sin, redeem from sin
words.note: A key concept in biblical theology referring to making amends for sin.
Often used in formal or literary contexts, especially with blessings or grace.
To grant forgiveness for a sin or offense.

verses.text: 「如果有人犯了罪，行了一件耶和華吩咐不可行的事；他雖然不清楚，仍是有罪，他就要擔當自己的罪責。

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for transgressions against God.
The Hebrew name for God.
Can refer to legal guilt or moral/religious sin.
Refers to the responsibility and consequences of sin.

verses.text: 他要依照你的估價，從羊群中把一隻沒有殘疾的公綿羊牽來，給祭司作贖愆祭。祭司為他贖罪，那不清楚的無心之失，就蒙赦免。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Often used for sacrificial animals in the Bible.

words.definition: atone for sin, redeem from sin

words.note: A formal phrase for an inadvertent transgression.
Often used in formal or literary contexts, especially with blessings or grace.
To grant forgiveness for a sin or offense.

verses.text: 這是贖愆祭，他在耶和華面前實在有罪。」

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Can refer to legal guilt or moral/religious sin.
